summary:
The Security Council, 
Recalling its resolutions on the arms embargo on Libya, 
Decides to extend authorizations for 12 months from 31 May 2024, as set out in resolution 2684 (2023). 
The Council replaces paragraph 5 of resolution 2292 with a new text, 
Authorizing Member States to seize and dispose of prohibited items, 
Noting obligations for Member States to comply and notify the Committee. 
Requires Member States to notify the Committee within 30 days of disposal. 
The Committee's approval is required within 90 days; 
Requests the Secretary-General to report on implementation within six and eleven months; 
Decides to remain seized of the matter.
